Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Sorry today was awful for you but be proud of yourself throughout the appointment with that tosser! you stayed focused and were able to put your point across. I am sure nobody with cancer has a particularly good prognosis without treatment!! Kind of obvious with the blighters mutiplying and flying all over the place that we need something to stop it in it's tracks. Get back to the UK where there is no language barrier (although sure your Spanish is excellent) butI would of thought it would take a bit of stress away.But without doubt get second opinion and specialist advice re your kidney/drug allergy issues. Wishing you strength to push through with all this - were are all behind you. xx P. s Chemo has been fine so far just bit tired and v little symptoms.

Posts.Title: PICC Line

Posts.Content: Squirrel, I was told intitially that it was chemo, mx and rads. I was told this way round due to my age? 42 back in May. I was told I was young to have BC? I was in such a state I didn't question why they do it this way round. Sorry not v helpful is it! But I responded well to chemo and felt a shrinkage/softening in lump each time. I had 3 fec adn 3 tax. It started at about 4cm and ended up 12mm so surgeon did a lumpectomy in the end. I am now having rad no 8 Christmas eve and have 12 to go. Skin holding out so far. Cxx
Posts.Title: is it shrinking ??

Next tax for me on thurs and think I'll try to avoid Codeine or if need it take half the recommended dose this time of Lactulose. Cx

Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

Posts.Content: Hi Sassy & everyone, ZUMBA...I wish...I went shopping for 3 hrs yesterday and felt wiped out. Not tired, wiped out heavy shoulders, shattered feeling.........this is 4 months after end of chemo!!!!!!!!!!!! I have had to lie down horizontal for most of day. I got away throughout chemo and surgery fairly lightly as far as symptoms go but boy did I pay on the lack of energy front. I have joined Pilates and did this last wed a week ago and felt knackered ever since. I also started diet, quite strict (1200 cals a day) since last Sat and am really finding it helpful to use MyFitnessPal as it tracks everything and I have lost 4 pounds since last sat. Woo hoo. Off to Florida week Friday so am going to really relax and do some gentle walking and swimming and hope by time I get back that I have bit more energy. Nurse told me 6 months after chemo to get drugs out of system. That will be March....bloody hope so anyway. Sick of feeling like this. Catherine xxx
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Yes it's FEC I'm on and Docex/Taxotare (6rounds) for last three. Oh Jo I know how you feel mine is everywhere. Thinning badly and at mo am sitting with turbie towel on head after washing. I am getting close to clippers. I can't sleep at all and can only think it's worry about this as it hurts my head too. Sick of it everytime I turn theres another raft of it. Making me feel sick! Sorry it sounds so shallow all in light of things but it's such a big deal to look so different. Been after round to for 2 days -nightmare! Just wiped out.
Posts.Title: Shrinkage after Round Chemo round !!

Posts.Content: Hi I have one. The Anaethestic was the stingy bit but after that just bit uncomfortable.. they fitted it and then you get xrayed to see if it's in right postition - took 2 minutes -then they pulled it back about 2cm. None of this was painful. It takes couple of weeks for it to settle down, you can kind of just feel it's there along you collar bone but after a while you don't even notice it. I am so glad I have it compared to needles in hand. they said i had thin veins so it was for the best. It's fine and you dont' feel meds going in. Cx
Posts.Title: New to Macmillan Support

Posts.Content: Hi all Sorry for lack of post I am so busy and tired. So for all you ladies about to embark on chemo or at beginning..... Had round 2 yesterday and got examined by Onc and I said lump feels different dare I say it bit smaller changed shape? She said what do you mean shrunk I'ts much smaller and softer The chemo is working !! She was realy inpressed and even said get the champagne out tonight! She said it was unusual to get shrinkiage before round two but feel I've been lucky so far. So pleased - proof it works ladies and hopefully will continue. Will catch up with you all when feeling bit more perky but for mean time back to bed I think. Keep the faith X

Posts.Title: feeling a bit low having mastectomy tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Annie How you feeling this morning? I have just fallen off my chair - you just said you have a 1cm by 1cm lump? that's an incredible improvement isn't it. I can't remember the original size of yours and realise some was swelling BUT that's amazing. Sounds smaller than mine! How dare you!! hehe Seriously though phone the BC nurses and see what they say and I'm sure it's just a reaction to chemo. I have the odd little brown like age spots on my legs and thought what the F are they but just put it down to the drugs. I'm sure as they are so powerful they have to have some outward effects. I'm off to see the surgeon at 11.40am today and not nervous......Now I'm worried I''m not nervous about being nervous!!!!!! but also as someone else said I don't think anyone can really tell what's going on until they have an MRI. Did you get one half way through? Mine is Friday - that's probably why not nervous as they can't tell by just prodding around only about general lump size so don't know what the surgeon thinks he's going to tell me. Hope you get some answers honey. CXX

Good luck and come here for advice or handholding if needed.x
Posts.Title: 1st chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: I think some people have had general or sedation. but I just had local anaestestic. It stung like hell but that soon abated and it was fine after that. It's just round to the inside of arm. Doesnt' brush against anything or interfere with anything. I've got a Limbo plastic arm cover so can still have baths/showers. I just ordred a few three quarter length cardies. The actual port doesnt' stick up much at all so no one would know who I hadn't told. Just have to have ti flushed with heparin once a week. Don't feel that either. also when it's out the minimal mark it makes (the line is couple of millimetres thick) I'm sure will fade quickly and cost it's round to inside you won't notice. Cx
Posts.Title: New to Macmillan Support

Posts.Content: Well done Pat It's been one hellava year but you did it and I am clawing to the top of my mountain too with 2 rads down and 18 to go! (thanks Dorothee just stealing you analogy! :-)) I am wishing you loads of health and happiness for 2013 and beeeyooooooonnd!!!!!!!!!!! Cxx
Posts.Title: To Infinity & Beyyyyyyond !!

Posts.Content: Hi Ethel and Welshie, Like I said not pleased your feeling like i do but pleased someone can empathise with me. I just wanted to know peoples stories of how long it too to recover for them. Sledgehammer -that's it. I would even go so far as to say it's about half as bad as chemo if you know what i mean. It's def wiped out and not tired. But Ethel I still can't sleep either and am on Tamezepam which is quite mild but helps to get off. I would be desperate if dr says I can't have them anymore as wake regularly in middle of night and just can't get back off. I sleep so light my poor husband just has to breathe and he's chucked in the spare room! Sorry about the burn Ethel sure it will fade in time. Mine "iron mark" is just still slightly red and gets worse if a bit of sun gets on it. Before rads I used Rosehip oil which is meant to be amazing for scar fading. I stopped obv throughout rads but will start slapping it on again now. I feel I have to keep telling people inc husband how bad I feel in case people look at me and think when is she gonna get off her behind! Let me know if any improvement - can't bloody wait! xx

Posts.Title: Don't think I can do another round :(

Posts.Content: Hey Pat This is my area of expertise!! haha since Oct 2010 i have had pouring eyes on and off and dry eyes at night. I get this for several months then it just goes. This started 18 months before chemo. Doestn't matter what weather it is hot cold windy no ryhme or reason. Think it started off through slight eye infection. The two opthalmologists I've seen say it's a symptom of dry eyes as the tear duct over produce to compensate for dryness at night (can't barely move eyeball)s then soon as get up pouring. It makes my eyes look awful and me really tired. I was give moisturising drops to give them extra fluid to hopefully conteract the dryness and stop watering. Also steroid drops worked for me too once but not at moment. Go see the doc. But also noticed side effects from chemo is sore eyes so that's not helping but will go back to dr once this is over. Re keeping eye makeup on you can buy makeup fixing spray. I've got Urban Decay (v expensive) which keeps it on for longer. But you can get cheaper makes. It's been nightmare fro me over last two yrs. Yes people think your updet so have to explain I'm not!! I can't concentrate on anything. When out shopping sometimes I give up and go home! See what dr says Good luck   Cxxx
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: Morning Annie I did it - chemo and hair dye haha! I hope I never have to have chemo every again please god (I'll start praying honest). Anyway the dye came out fine even though picked lighter shade it is a bit darker but tried to just do the streaks as dont' need it all over. it's made it nice and shiny and I don't look so washed out. the only thing is I normally use root touch up and it's a waste of a ten pound bottle. The Daniel Field stuff does it enable you to use in three separate uses as that would work out cheaper? Well done you for be brave with the fringe thing. i can't let mine down and look normalish as it's very thin on top. But saying that did I tell you the bald bits in front of ears growig back babyhair ish and devoid of much colour but who care it's hair!! i have been hairdrying but gently. Tongs or straigthners don't do anything as most of hair just seems a bit dead and won't respond. People still tell me that if they didn't know they wouldn't realise what I'd gone though so it was worth it. Wasnt' sorry to see back of hideous cap though. so glad it's making you feel more like your old self - it gives you such a boost - people dont' realise how crap the visible effects and lack of confidence make you feel do they?   CXx

Posts.Title: Naturtint Hair dye anyone used it on chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Mal Was just going to post same thing....... I was dx 1st may 12 had chemo, wle in oct and rads over Xmas. I am in Florida at moment on hols, it's beautiful weather but its as much as I can do to drag myself down shops (in car) and physically stand up for an hour! I keep thinking what's wrong with me why am I not slowly feeling better. Even my arms when I overdo it feel like lead and I cannot lift them. BUT. . Around mid dec I cycled five miles round local reservoir and was v tired but not wiped out. Felt i was finally gettin over chemo and feeling back to old self. I could not do that at all at moment so the moral of story I think is that yes rads are a breeze compared to chemo etc but Dont underestimate them either. This has only kicked post week three really. And yes when u are tired it really brings on the dark thoughts. It's horrible. But when slept properly I feel quite positive. If u are physically shattered and wiped out though its hard to keep ur pecker up. And I feel I have to keep telling people how I feel all the time as look fine. It's just time I suppose and we'll get there in end. Sorry I know that's boring but its true. Love and hugs X

Posts.Title: TRAVEL INSURANCE

Posts.Content: Hi Tamsin, That's really kind of you......... All the things that Eider said plus: One thing about chemo is its really boring sometimes when you spend days laying in bed. Just having someone around for a chat or to waffle on about their stuff helped me. Be aware that they might just not have the energy to even listen to you though. But some company to keep in touch with life outside your bedroom walls is good. Also having a little radio by here bedside is a good idea as sometimes I couldn't even focus on tv I was so wiped out. Even if it's to nod off to! I did find it very hard giving over completly to someone else re housework (luckily it was my Mum as I'm a bit of a slob!) cooking etc, we all have a certain amount of pride but she will eventually get used to this and realise that you just have to accept help. Like Eider said good friends make such a difference through all this. Cx
Posts.Title: What to do to help

Posts.Content: Hi I think, terrifying as it is, shooting pains, aches, stitches are all par for the course. I am 8 months past diagnosis and still have them. That's after chemo, lumpectomy and at beginning of rads. At the beginning shooting pains were what alerted me to a problem without there being a lump. 10 days later after prodding around again bam! golf ball sized lump out of nowhere! (40mm) I was reassured it's the lump pressing on nerves which cause this. Apart from this at start I had shooting pains all over and still do sometimes, I was just extreme stress as despite me thinking it was rampaging though my body, it wasn't as had all clear scans everywhere else. I definitley wasn't imagining it.   Cxx
Posts.Title: Lump pain

Posts.Content: Hi Squirrel, I am gonna say it...........it's not so bad. I was just like you getting myself so worked up I felt sick. Cried when it was being administered. Even had Tramadol on standby. ...........the pain is what scared me more than anything. So I took 1 standard paracetamol and 1 ibroprophen each on the hour. someone here posted that she did it this way so there was no dip in pain relief. I didn take more sometimes but generally it worked. I didn't get bone pain. For me it jsut felt like stabbling pains like apikey electric shocks, don't be alarmed by that either as I felt they were bearable. Didn't need tramadol at all. I know alot of people on here find it awful but for me it was better than Fec as I didn't feel it wiped me out in same way and thank the lord no sickness. So for me............ Nails fine, just a slight yellow line running through, but I blacked them up and put colour over top. Hair starting filling in. No hospital admissions. Slight furry mouth -eat ice lollies, feels great! OK what I hated about it........... Struggled to walk 100yds after for about 8 weeks, I could do it but laid me flat next day. Hated injections to boost blood cells but they were keeping me out of hospital and I'm so thankful I was offered them. There are a few of us on here who didn't find it too bad so take heart and try to relax a bit about it and like everyone says it may be ok for you. I hope it goes well. C xx P.s somehow I managed to go camping for the weekend in the middle of it!!

Posts.Content: No you can't as you need to be really gentle with it. I am two weeks past round two and it thinned massivly after that which is traumatic and am sure it's kept me awake at night! I know what you saying re if it look that bad you may as well wear a wig but it's not that bad yet and the thinning has also slowed dramatically. I am not keen on hairdresser as scared they will brush it too hard. At the end of the day even if it does eventually get too thin to look decent it's shortened the time I am without hair for a couple of months. x

Posts.Content: Hello Annie I'm glad you had a nice holiday. I went to Bournemouth for the weekend and it was sunny and hot all weekend and did take my mind off things a bit but it's always there. You are not the only one worrying as I was fretting last night about my upcoming MRI at end of August and thinking will it show some other area where it's spread! But I've just got to try and stay calm as there's no point in worrying about something that's not happened ..........ha ha wish I could follow my own advice!! I know what you meant about the gap in between or our good weeks feeling ok then all the appointments bloods etc start up again and the hospital.. errghh I hate them now! But your on round 4 coming up? I think. So back half of treatment Woohoo! I am now saying week Thurs it's my penultimate one then only one left! and although i've not suffered too bad I will be so pleased to get this over with (well this bit anyway). Love and hugs to you pm if you want a chat x

Posts.Content: Hi I am past chemo now (16 days). I used it and can still go out and people who don't know I think don't notice. It's growing back and filling in the bald spots I got in front of ears and on top. I got round this by pinning fringe back and it looked ok. Now it's still coming out a bit and I cannot afford to lose any more as it will look too thin. I think it's worth it if you have thick hair in first place. But can honestly say, so much comes out, if your hair is thinnish then I would say it wouldn't be worth it. Yes it does delay treatment alot but for me I would do it again. I have this conversation about my bloody hair most days trying to get reassurance from husband it still looks ok!! it's a personal decision really but I know I would be so devastated if I didn't have any. Despite it looking like crap most of time! Cx

Posts.Title: A Cold cap - did it work for you?

Posts.Content: I use "say yes to tomatoes" shampoo. As meant to have amazing thickening properties but doesnt' seem to make much difference to me although it's not got much rubbish in it. the nurses always said use ph neutral shampoos. Just be gentle with brushing/ gently dry with hairdryer.etc. I am like you normally wash daily but I probably do it every 2 to 3 days. Oh and don't put any heat source close to roots like straightners or tongs. I have a shower cap to put on head when just having shower and don't want to get hair wet. And a turbie towel (microfibre thing) to take alot of moisture out after washing.Cx

Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hello Ladies, I just thought I would post to all those awaiting Docetaxal/Taxotere treatment. I was absolutley terrified of this and got into such a state. But just wanted to say (and hope I'm not jinxing myself) that for me it's been a better experience than FEC. 3 days after treatment stabbing pains neck down uncomfortable but not unbearable. Started to take Ibruprophen/Paracetamol and Codeine. Was told every 2 hrs but took lower dose after advice on here every hr. Sometimes full dose every 2hrs. this continued for 5 days then started stabbing pains started wearing off. Day 7 just few tabs a day. Day 10 today and just taken a couple of painkillers. I've had lower back ache (just ache) and leg ache a bit throughout all of this too but the painkillers have kept everything for me under control. The codeine made me have tummy aches/constipation and was sick twice, I believe as was very bunged up. Lactulose cleared me out (literally) but felt much better. No sickness apart from that and slept much better due to minimal steroids. The total wipe out I had with FEC has not occured with this. Just tired and cannot do too much. slight furry feel to mouth but no ulcers or anything. On Day 7 of treatment went away to coast for weekend and I don't think I could of done this on FEC. I don't mean to be insensitive to the other ladies that have has real bad reactions but felt another view would help some of the ladies about to have it. As we know wer are all different and react in different ways to this. Get prepared with the painkillers mouth wash etc which helps with the anxiety of something new and unknown. I felt so much better having Tramadol on hand but didnt' need it in the end. Godd luck ladies I hope it's not too bad for you. C xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hello Just thought I would add my bit, as were on a good news roll..... Had my lumpectomy on 4th Oct and two weeks later I saw surgeon and he was really over the moon for me. My lump had eventually shrunk from 4cm to (after 5th round chemo) 17mm, then final results 12mm after round 6. I got clear margins and they took 3 lymph nodes and they were clear too. My ex army surgeon was welling up he was so hapy for me! Since seen the rads consultant and I have to have 4 weeks worth. She said because of my age (43) I needed extra week boost. (now I'm old. At beginning I was considered young! haha.) Certainly feel like I've aged over the summer. Feel like I've come through this relatively unscathed but am still so tired and can't do much even though I'm over 7 weeks after last chemo but very happy nonetheless and nice to have that bastard lump out!!! Bring on the radiation! :-) Cxx

Posts.Title: Anyone had hair regrowth between cycles Fec and T?

Posts.Content: Hi Luvvie I started this thread as was so terrified and it's turned out really ok and wanted to let others know it's not all bad. I have had my second one now and I am on day 6 and have only taken about 6 Ibroprophen/Paracetamol. The first one I took tablets for several days every couple of hrs, although didn't need them in night. So this 2nd round of it has been even better than first Tax. So has my body acclimatised to if for want of a better word? Who cares just so pleased it's do able for me and it's shows you we are all different and react in different ways. so try not to worry too much - just get prepared with all the painkillers you may need. My tramadol is still untouched :-)) Just one thing I will say - I can only do say an hrs of cooking going out etc before I need to lie down and rest for half an hr but still it's not the complete wipeout like on FEC. Good luck hun, x
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi I also have the same worry. I have a dull ache in side on and off for over a month now and it's really worrying me. Just obsessed as it's where your liver is! Saw Rads consultant for follow up and she couldn't feel anything. she was more worried about my state of mind!! Kept saying you should make an appointment to go to maggies centre to talk to someone in Oxford. ( I am a very positive person and got through chemo really well). I was offered a ct scan of body which I am having today. Crappping myself as she will call me with results in next few days. She said they don't offer them out as a follow up not because of cost but because obvioulsly if it's spread then it can't be cured just controlled and some people don't want to know that information.............huh? Surely if there is something there it's better to deal with it early?? Anyway hopefully it's nothing. But I would rather get it checked out just in case. It's true what they say this is the hardest bit after treatment. NOT because I want to be cosseted by appointments and hospital visits....(never want to see the bloody place again!) but it's hard to live with the FEAR! and just get on with it when you have niggling pains all the time. When my ache isn't there I almost forget about all this crap. Consultant doesn't think it will make any difference to my state of mind but it will I'm sure. I don't want to waste my time worrying and just want to get on with life -love it too much and have to many things I want to do.
Posts.Title: new pain and worried!

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies It's tough but you will get through it and it weirdly goes fairly quickly once you start ticking off each round. I am out the other end and 8 weeks past radiotherapy. the best advice I had was don't worry yourself stupid over every little side effect. It doesn't mean to say you are going to get all of them. And there is some sort of medicine to conteract any s/e's, for everything. Search this board if you have a problem and you'll find that at one time or another someone has experienced what you have. And accept as hard (as it may be) any help you can get. Take care Cx
Posts.Title: nervous about starting chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Clarey bear I saw you were worried and another lady on here so thought I might give you a bit of hope that it's not all bad. Before i had it one lady said she "sailed though it" and that cheered me up so much albeit still scared. another thing they did which gave me a massive boost and made me feel less like a patient was remove my picc line ( I don't know whether you have one) but she said as Docetaxal is just one drug it doesn't wreck your veins. so she removed it one my say so and I didn't feel a thing! It's made such difference to everything clothes hiding it from neighbours etc Bathing! Really hope it goes smoothly with not too many s/e. Remember Codeine and anything containing it causes bad constipation which is painful in itself so try to avoid/limit if possible. Cx

Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Annie pm'd you x Today was fine and had to sit in isolaton for 1.5hrs. It's gone 6pm and had hug with son who is next door at at Grandma's but DH gone over as he is upset bless him. He is quite sensitive so worried about me i think. He wanted to see injection site!  He came up to me in bed this morning with a notepad and pen playing waiters. He said what would you like to eat and I said I can't but will have water and he said ice with that and trotted off to get it for me and charged me £5 for ice and £5 for water!! I wasn't worried about having scan. I have been poked and prodded due to recurrent miscarriage treatment over last 7 months so not that scared of any of this anymore..........it's the results I'm crapping myself about. My onc seems to like phoning me with results when on own. And cos it's the bone...well just scared of spread. should think it'll be Monday now so will try to enjoy weekend and keep busy. Scan was in Nuclear Dept ! and injection was in heavy metal box..god knows what it's done to me! I was left alone in scan room with cold fan blowing in face and no music. B**stards! :-)) Thanks for all you advice good luck with Chemo Mon Amanda and let us know how you bear up, hopefully won't be too bad for you. P. S Bring on the vat of vino over the weekend I say, as can't see me feeling like it after next wed, so making the most of it!
Posts.Title: My results

Posts.Content: Hello Ok the results from this  morning: Grade 3, Stage early, HER negative, not hormone sensitive. Lymph nodes = not affected but slight thickening of one, may be disease may not. Only 1 lump now not 1 large and two small so spose they were always connected, size 21mm x 32 x 38mm. FEC -D treatment with Taxotere, giving me extra anti-sickness meds and Lorazapam. (to help with sleep and anxiety!) She said if chemo shrinks tumour then maybe possible to get away with Lumpectomy. But we'll wait and see. Think I would like to prepare for worst and anything less is a bonus. I knew I would have Rads but didn't realise is I will have to have them everyday for 3/4 weeks! in Oxford. anyone else had that much? Tomorrow PET CT scan for bone 1cm abnormal area, this takes 2.5hrs after injection and I will be radioactive and can't hug my son tomorrow night so sending him to grandma's. DH said I can just stand there and hold a microwave meal for us for dinner haha v funny not! Mon pre chemo meet, wig fitting! Proper shop this time with 60% reduction on NHS. Tue Picc line fitted Oxford and marker for inside location of lump Wed - Chemo 11am aaarrgghh. Actually I;m ok. Feel better. But still dreading bone thing and she said she'll phone me about that. I am too scared to look at any info on that. Will talk to son later. DH told his teacher and head and she was v supportive. What do you think of my results? x

If I was going to get any symptoms throughout this it was going to be the wiped out s/e. it's really frustrating, knowing if I unload dishwasher I have to lie down!! I think we pack so much into our daily lives it's v hard to do nothing! I don't know how any one works through this . I can't even remember what day it it let alone concentrate on work. I appreciate wanting to regain some normality though. I felt so wiped out fri sat last week I had a blood test to check neuts and it's all fine. I've just overdone it if you can call going food shopping overdoing it. One improvement today is legs not quite as stiff. Can't wait to see what it feels like to not have chemo on thurs. AAhhhh........................
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jelly   It's a brilliant feeling and so emotional - like coming out of a long dark tunnel and back to being human again.   congratulations. cxx
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: Wow don't know how or if I can express what I feel tonight. You ladies are so wise and articulate my words may be inadequate but all I know is tonight I just have tears rolling down my face with relief. Relief chemo is over. I had my last Chemo (3 fec/3tax) last Thursday and I am a week on. I thought the emotions might spill over as I've been quite together for the duration of the chemo. The first time I have spoken with BC nurse was the other day.I didnt' think I needed her, I thought I was tough. Whereas actually it was quite nice to hear her soothing tones over the phone, sympathising with my stupid worries over surgery to come and rads. Saying that it's taken a week to get hold of her. What i'm trying to say is I feel free. Free of drugs. Free of injections (last one last night). Free of picc lines. Free of being wiped out. Free of painkillers. Free of being bound to my bed. I never want to feel vunerable again. Ever. It's felt like being imprisoned since May. I went out on my own this afternoon, no chaperone in case I felt unwell. Just me in my car with music really loud. Do you know how normal I felt? I think only you ladies will understand, I know only you ladies wll understand. All the cliches are true: I will slow down, live for the moment, appreciate what I've got and take time to enjoy it. I will never take my health forgranted again. I will be forever thankful to my Mum and Stepfather whom have done everything I have needed and been there there without question. I will cherish my darling boy who has just taken all this in his stride. I will hold dear my husband and friends who have just kept things normal for me. and thanks to my gorgeous kittycat whom seems to have a sixth sense of when i'm down and has kept me amused through all this. He is now a leggy rascal who has grown up whilst I've been in bed the last few months. I never knew pets could be so comforting and perceptive! This is starting to sound like an Oscars acceptance speech so i'll wrap it up! I know I am not out of the woods yet. I still have to wait for the final results after surgery but I feel the debilitating bit is over and i can only feel physically better day by day from now on. I feel really happy to have got through it and proud of myself and can't wait to restart my life (Someone warn me if this is some kinda post chemo euphoric afterglow!) thanks for reading hope I haven't bored everyone stupid. Cxx
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: It was a no brainer for me. I had chemo, surgery and rads and yes four months past all treatment still shattered but no other side effects apart from ones brought on by being forced into menopause. I admit to being so scared on diagnoses that just said yes to everything onc suggested. I trusted the experts and their experience and just wanted take everything offered to me to get rid of this shitty disease for my family and my gorgeous boy. If I had not taken chemo I would be sitting here now terrified that hadn't given myself best chance.

Posts.Title: Cold cap? any advice

Posts.Content: Hi I decided with Onc to go and have g testing as there is alot of prostate and couple of cases of leukemia in cousinsand uncles. I am also triple neg. It was just a half hr talk. detailed about whole family so be prepared with family tree and notes! then simple blood test. I had to wait 13 weeks for result from test which was done at Northampton but sent for analysis at Oxford. All was negative. Once I had test done and was waiting I was very worried and thought what have i done as if it was positive it was have pushed me into the dilemma of whether to remove both breasts (i had lumpectomy in end). So was very anxious awaiting results. But the big positive even though nothing found was that both my sisters now are entitled to yearly mamograms the same as me. So it was worth it jsut for that. XX
Posts.Title: Genetic testing

Posts.Content: Hi Annie/Ladies, This for me was all really doable. I am 15 days past now cycle 1. I too have been scared about infection and DS getting ill, but I am over the 10-14 day immunes drop off so hope fully I will be ok this month. Just keep away from anyone else with colds etc ( there isn't alot you can do I spose about kids). I found first 5 days sicky on and off. Take all the recommended anti sick. One of mine was 10 - 20mg and I tried to get away with 10mg and was bordering on throwing up but took it and half hr later was ok again. They work pretty quick. Make sure people realise you need to take regular rest, even if it's just shutting you eyes on sofa for 10 mins. It keeps you going. The actual drip - mine was hadn fed into me for 50 mins was a doodle and didn't feel bad apart from bit sleepy at one point. Felt fine until got home and couple hrs later def needed the tabs. I think mine were spot on for me actually By day 5 after you take one in morinin and you feel a bit lost! But I have some back up ones if I need them. Cold cap is a pain but jsut take paracetamol half hr before you have it. Worst for first 20mins and then it's was v berarble. Oh and then took Ibropropehn into last hr with it as felt bit dizzy with dull head. But no migrains or anything But we have to remember everyones' different. Day 10 after, I have had a few mouth ulcers, tiny ones and got rif of them with salt water wash in mouth. Also tmi - hair down below started last night to come out in clumps in bath !! Don't care about that but thought oh shit are eyebrow and lashes will be going, so inspecting them with magnifying glass!! but the cold cap must be working to certain extent as very few hairs on head lost so far.   Good luck ladies hope is good as my first chemo. x

Obviously we all have to be aware of oeostrogen in our bodies especially if you are Hormone receptive. I am triple neg (very triple neg) but even Onc said she wasn't happy with me taking Red Clover for flushes as should be avoiding anything including Phyto Estrogens. So I stopped taking them immediatley. My problem isn't flushes though, I can put up with them..... it's whether it's contributing to my Chronic Fatigue which is absolutley debilitating. I would be really greatful. Love to you all xx
Posts.Title: Chemo induced Menopause after BC/ Triple Neg

Posts.Content: Hi If you are offered the PICC line take it. It was brilliant for me and you can have your bloods taken through it too. I had 3 x FEC and am having 3 x Tax at moment - now have round 5 Thurs of 6. On first Tax as it's only one drug instead of 3 together she asked if i wanted it removed - I had it out and didn't feel a thing on removal. but it was so worth having it. Hair - as I said 5th round this week and still have hair. I have to clip fringe back so it covers a wide parting but if you didnt' know me you prob wouldn't guess what was wrong with me. I have lost half my hair I reckon and it much much thinner but still worth using cold cap for me. Saying that eyebrows getting bit patchy and eyelashes sparse but with eyemakeup it helps to disguise that. I think someone said they were last to go. Downstairs was first bang on day 14 like they said! But who cares about that bit! Hang on in there it gets better when all the shock wears off and you have a plan. Your mental state is so much worse when you feel physically poorly too but mine picks up alot in my good two weeks and I'm just thankful to be alive and doing normal things.

Posts.Title: The Film Thread

Posts.Content: Hi Annie Didn't want to read and run so just replying before I take my son to tennis....The ladies have said it all this woman is a poor communicator obviously. The book I think you got that I am still on is a triumph over these diagnosies 4 ongoing different re-occurances and she is thriving over a decade on! Shows you against all the odds you can beat this bastard C. I too am not interested in prognosis - I just want to get fit and healthy again and make the best of it. whatever that is. I don't think i could bear to know and why waste a single minute. I have also had lots of strange experts with a weird manner. Even my Onc who I think is really good got misinformed by some initial biop results and gave me some misinformation. So they are not all infalliable. But she should have got your info correct before she saw you. I would be inclined to seek another opinion I think. But I know having the strenght and energy to do that must be hard right now. Wish I could come up and give you a big hug honey. You've got your lovely hubby and children - hold onto that. Beat this for them. Catherine xx
Posts.Title: horrible onc appt, horrible news

Posts.Content: Hi Michelle I still have blue nipple but surgery was only 4 weeks ago. i would have thought that would have cleared up by now. Maybe you could speak with you BC nurse or ladies on helpline here.CX
Posts.Title: Blue/green dye from Sentinel Node Biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi Annie My experience was that had one anti sick left to take on day 5 and thought "oh god how do I get through rest day" but I did it ok by not doing alot and drinking lots of water and popping the odd Met....tab you mentioned to help me when needed it. Then felt fine for a few days, then dipped again on day 7/8 I think and felt sicky all day. Just eased it by small snacking. Hope you feel bit better tomorrow. Can anyone take the kids to school for you? I found the mornings tough.cx
Posts.Title: Day 4 after FEC-still green around the gills

Posts.Content: Hey Julie Yes they told me my periods would stop too. Bet they bloody don't. that would have been one positive for me. Especially as been told that this is prob end of fertility and was desperatly trying for sibling for my son. Periods seem pointless. sorry not in good mood tonight!! Julie did you keep you hair all the way through? x
Posts.Title: Day 4 after FEC-still green around the gills

Posts.Content: Hi Rosie My chemo nurse said dark or black out nail polish too. So I did it and have used couple of coats of dark polish. My nails have survived intact and no ridges. I shall continue to do this for about another 6 weeks just incase! May seem ott but I'd rather no have yet another visible side effect of this. The more normal we can remain the better we feel I think. C xx P.s Saying that I am absolutley sick of painting several coats on toes and hands and will relish going au naturel before long!!! All this maintenance is a pain but worth it.
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: Hi Angie thanks for the heads up. Can I ask how long did you keep painting your nails for? Getting fed up of it but spose I should keep doing it for a while now. Also (sorry for picking your brains) how long was it before you felt pretty ok physically again after the tax? Thanks Cxx
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: Hi Angie Thanks for the info. I am sorry if i mislead you but i have finished chemo. God I've finished chemo..............I HAVE FINISHED CHEMO.................. Hey back with you now :-)) Haven't barely had any s/e apart from severe shatteredness (that's my new word!!) Just wondered how long to get over this. Warm baths are a regular fixture for me every night haha. I have been addicted to them all my life! You have done amazingly well to be on form 3 months after chemo. you must feel soo good about that. That's what i miss, feeling fittish. I was never super fit but love my bike and can't wait to go cycling again. Well just to walk round to school really without having to lay down afterwards! I am going to start racking the vitamin intake up too. It's funny how similar to being pregnant this is in some ways. I remember saying that I was sick of feeling fat and tired, ( I now know what tired is) and that I wanted to run through the fields when baby had come. haha That's how I feel now, miss just being able to walk anywhere. But what I really would love to do is run up and down hills screaming I'm alive!!!!!!!!!!!! Ok one step at a time................ I dont know about be friending me, you probably think I'm a complete nutter! thanks again for your reply CXX
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: Hi Sue when is your first Docetaxal? I have one more fec on thursday, then I am on Docet next think it's 27th July or somewhere round there. don't know why but scared of it as keep thinking Bone pain!! I just worried they won't give me any decent painkillers straight away, like the Tramadol some of the ladies have mentioned. anything less doesn't seem to cut it. Cx
Posts.Title: One week post Tax and no appetite

Posts.Content: Yes I feel knackered stiff and about 90 too. I am 11 and half weeks past last tax and still knackered. People think I'm doing good and I spose I am but I kind of reserve what energy I have for important things like getting son to school and then collapse on sofa or have a bath which perks me up slightly. I have only been able to get son to school every day for last couple of weeks (2 mins round corner). Up until then about 6 weeks after chemo could only walk about 200yrds without having to lay down for a long time and feeling shattered. I have fared well with the chemo but as a person who needs alot of sleep and gets tired easily I had a sneaky feeling this would affect me alot and it has. Saw onc the other day and she said that I wouldn't feel totally myself for 18months to 2yrs!! The thing is as long as there a bit of improvement that we can see each week that's the main thing. And a diary is a good idea as you do forget that little bit you couldn't do last week. We'll all be different in our recovery times but spose the moral of the story is Patience!.........yawn.
Posts.Title: How long does the fatigue last?

Posts.Content: Hi doing ok thanks not too many s/e's. Was wiped out with round 2 o fec though. But just feel so lucky to feel normal (apart from knackered) in second 2 weeks. I am just hoping they will send me out of unit with something and not just Co codamol. Like you don't want to be in a complete state trying to run around/arrange it after I'm in pain, if I am. Wonder if they will offer it up front iykwim. this is halfway for me with chemo hopefully if things go aheead on Thurs, so will be pleased to be on the back half! x

Posts.Content: Hi My second tax is on Thursday next week. It makes your nails sensitive to light and they wil become ridged and yellow or fall out I was told. I hate the black but I paint it underneath the dark pink I had on for a wedding today. Good luck I found it so far better than FEC ! C x
Posts.Title: Black nail varnish & Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca I used pure Rosehip oil too before rads to condition skin. Stopped when using rads, just uses organic aqueous cream. Skin so far so good. Finished rads today and nurse said looking good and doesn't think skin will break down. Has it helped who knows but it is meant to be brillaint for scars so for face it sounds worth a try too. Catherine xx
Posts.Title: Skin care recommendations, please

Posts.Content: Hi I had it too. Used Canesten from Boots and it sorted it out no problem. Hbby got it for me and the only thing they said if I was on AB's which is was was that the oral pill wouldn't work, so just used the external cream and that was fine and soon as was off AB's I took the pill and it was gone quickly. Cxx
